Sunflower.passage: Sunflower is a plant that belongs to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the North American continent and has been cultivated for thousands of years by various indigenous cultures. Sunflower seeds are commonly used as a snack food, and sunflower oil is used in cooking and as a base for salad dressings. The sunflower plant is a tall, showy annual that can grow up to 30 feet (9 meters) tall. The leaves are a deep green color and are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. The flowers are large and bright yellow, with petals that are highly sensitive to touch and can move in response to wind. The flower heads are typically composed of many individual flowers that bloom in a pattern from the outer petals to the inner ones. Sunflower seeds are produced in the flower head and are surrounded by a hard, woody shell. When the seeds are mature, they are harvested and dried before being shelled. The seeds can be roasted, ground into a meal, or used to make oil. Sunflower oil is extracted from the seeds by pressing them, and it is commonly used in cooking and as a base for salad dressings. Sunflower plants are also used as a source of food for humans and animals. The leaves and stems are edible and can be cooked like spinach. The roots can be roasted and used as a coffee substitute. Sunflower seeds are a popular snack and are often sold in packaged form or as a garnish on salads and sandwiches. In addition to their culinary uses, sunflowers have a number of medicinal properties.

qae_pairs.question: What is the length of time that sunflower cultivation has been practiced by indigenous cultures?
qae_pairs.explanation: The passage states that sunflower cultivation has been practiced by indigenous cultures for thousands of years. Therefore, the length of time that sunflower cultivation has been practiced by indigenous cultures is thousands of years.

qae_pairs.explanation: The family of the plant that is commonly known as Sunflower is Asteraceae.

Carrot.passage: Carrot is a root vegetable, usually orange in color, but can also be found in yellow, red, and purple varieties. It is one of the most widely cultivated and consumed vegetables in the world. Carrots are high in fiber, vitamins, and minerals, including vitamin A, potassium, and folate. They are also a good source of antioxidants. Carrots are native to the Middle East and South Asia, and have been cultivated for thousands of years. They were first introduced to Europe in the 13th century, and have since become a staple in many cuisines around the world. Carrots can be eaten raw or cooked, and are often used in salads, stews, soups, and roasted dishes. Carrots are also used as a medicinal herb in some cultures. They are believed to have a number of health benefits, including improving digestion, boosting the immune system, and reducing the risk of heart disease. Carrots are also used in cosmetics and personal care products, due to their high content of beta-carotene, which is converted to vitamin A in the body. Overall, carrots are a versatile and nutritious vegetable that can be enjoyed in a variety of ways. Whether eaten raw or cooked, carrots are a great addition to any healthy diet.

qae_pairs.question: What is the native region of Carrot?
qae_pairs.explanation: The native region of Carrot is the Middle East.

qae_pairs.explanation: According to the passage, carrots have been cultivated and consumed for thousands of years.

Tomato.passage: Tomato is a plant that is part of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. The species Solanum lycopersicum is the most commonly grown and eaten type of tomato. The fruit is a berry that is typically red, with a soft texture and a savory flavor. Tomatoes are grown in many countries and are used in a variety of dishes, including salads, sandwiches, soups, and pasta sauces. Tomatoes are native to South America, and were first cultivated by the Aztecs. They were brought to Europe in the 16th century by Spanish explorers, and quickly became popular in Italian cuisine. Today, tomatoes are grown all over the world, with the United States being one of the largest producers. Tomatoes are a good source of vitamins A and C, as well as potassium and folate. They are also low in calories and fat, making them a healthy addition to any diet. In addition to being eaten raw, tomatoes can also be cooked in a variety of ways, including roasting, grilling, and frying. Overall, tomatoes are a versatile and nutritious food that are enjoyed by people all over the world. Whether eaten raw or cooked, they add flavor and nutrition to many different dishes.

Lettuce.passage: Lettuce is a leafy vegetable that is part of the plant family Asteraceae, which includes cabbage, artichokes, and daisies. It is a cool-season crop that is grown in many parts of the world, including Europe, North America, and Asia. Lettuce is a hardy plant that can withstand a range of temperatures, but it prefers cooler weather. Lettuce is a biennial plant, which means that it takes two years to complete its life cycle. In the first year, the plant grows a rosette of leaves and stores energy in a thick root. In the second year, the plant produces a tall stem with a flower head at the top. Lettuce is a versatile vegetable that can be eaten raw or cooked. It is a good source of vitamins A and C, as well as folate and potassium. Lettuce is also low in calories and fat, making it a healthy addition to any diet. There are many different types of lettuce, including romaine, butterhead, and leaf lettuce. Each type has its own unique flavor and texture. Romaine lettuce is crisp and slightly bitter, while butterhead lettuce is mild and sweet. Leaf lettuce is a bit more bitter than butterhead lettuce and has a slightly crisper texture. Lettuce is a popular ingredient in salads, sandwiches, and wraps. It is also used in soups, stews, and stir-fries.

qae_pairs.question: What is the life cycle of lettuce?
qae_pairs.explanation: The life cycle of lettuce is two years. In the first year, the plant grows a rosette of leaves and stores energy in a thick root. In the second year, the plant produces a tall stem with a flower head at the top.

qae_pairs.explanation: Lettuce belongs to the plant family Asteraceae, which includes cabbage, artichokes, and daisies.

Cucumber.passage: Cucumber is a widely cultivated plant in the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae. It is a creeping vine that bears fruit, usually called a cucumber, but also includes its seeds. Cucumbers are typically long, cylindrical, and green, but can be found in a variety of colors, including yellow, orange, and even striped. They are a good source of vitamin C, potassium, and fiber. Cucumbers are native to India and Southeast Asia, and have been cultivated there for thousands of years. They were introduced to Europe by the ancient Greeks and Romans, and have been grown there since the 4th century. Today, cucumbers are grown on every continent except Antarctica, and are a staple in many cuisines around the world. Cucumbers can be grown in a variety of soils and climates, but prefer well-drained soil that is rich in organic matter. They require a lot of water, and can be grown in both hot and cool climates. Cucumbers are typically grown from seed, which can be started indoors or outdoors, depending on the climate. The plants are trained to grow up trellises or other supports, and can be pruned to encourage more fruit. Cucumbers can be eaten raw or cooked, and are used in a wide variety of dishes. They are often used in salads, sandwiches, and dips, but can also be pickled, fermented, or roasted. In some cuisines, cucumbers are used as a garnish or accompaniment to meat or fish dishes.

qae_pairs.question: What is the native region of cucumber?

Pea.passage: Pea is a type of legume that is commonly consumed as a vegetable. It is a small, round, and green vegetable that is often boiled or steamed and served as a side dish. Peas are native to the Middle East and South Asia, and they have been cultivated for thousands of years. They are a good source of protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals. Pea plants are easy to grow and can be planted in the spring or fall. They prefer cool weather and can be grown in most types of soil. Peas are typically planted in rows, and the seeds are spaced about an inch apart. The plants grow quickly and produce small, green pods that contain the peas. Pea pods can be eaten fresh or dried, and they are often used in soups, stews, and salads. Peas can also be frozen or canned for long-term storage. There are many different varieties of peas, including sugar snap peas, snow peas, and garden peas. In addition to being a popular vegetable, peas have a number of medicinal uses. They are often used to treat digestive problems, such as constipation and diarrhea. Peas are also used to reduce inflammation and to promote healthy skin. Overall, peas are a healthy and versatile vegetable that can be enjoyed in a variety of ways. Whether eaten fresh or cooked, peas are a delicious and nutritious addition to any meal.

Potato.passage: Potatoes are a type of plant that belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. They are native to South America and are now grown and consumed all over the world. Potatoes are a staple food in many cultures and are known for their versatility in cooking. They can be boiled, roasted, fried, or mashed, and are used in a variety of dishes such as soups, stews, salads, and casseroles. Potatoes are an excellent source of complex carbohydrates, vitamins, and minerals. They are low in fat and calories and are a good source of dietary fiber. Potatoes are also a good source of potassium, which is important for maintaining healthy blood pressure. There are many different varieties of potatoes, each with its own unique characteristics. Some potatoes are small and round, while others are long and thin. Some are bumpy and some are smooth. Some potatoes are yellow or red on the outside, while others are brown or white. Potatoes are easy to grow and can be planted in a variety of soils and climates. They are also resistant to pests and diseases, making them a popular crop for farmers. In addition to their culinary uses, potatoes have a number of other practical applications. They can be used as animal feed, as a source of biofuels, and as a natural source of fertilizer. Overall, potatoes are a versatile and nutritious food that have been a staple in many cultures for centuries. They are easy to grow and can be used in a variety of ways, making them a valuable crop for farmers and a delicious and healthy food for consumers.

Bean.passage: Bean is a common name for several different types of seeds, including: 1. Soybean, Glycine max, is a legume native to East Asia, but is now widely grown in many other regions around the world. It is an important source of protein and oil for human and animal consumption, as well as for use in industry. 3. Kidney bean, also known as the red bean, is a variety of Phaseolus vulgaris. It is named for its kidney-like shape and is a popular bean for use in soups, stews, and salads. 4. Lima bean, also known as the butter bean, is a variety of Phaseolus limensis. It is named for its resemblance to the lima lima bean, and is a popular bean for use in soups, stews, and salads. 5. Navy bean, also known as the pea bean, is a variety of Phaseolus vulgaris. It is named for its use in navy stews, and is a popular bean for use in soups, stews, and salads. 6. Cannellini bean, also known as the white kidney bean, is a variety of Phaseolus vulgaris. Asteraceae.passage: 1. Asteraceae is a family of flowering plants that includes daisies, sunflowers, and asters. 2. The family is one of the largest and most diverse in the plant kingdom, with over 23,000 species. 3. Asteraceae are found on every continent except Antarctica, and are adapted to a wide range of habitats, from deserts to rainforests. 4. Many Asteraceae are herbaceous perennials, meaning they die back to the ground each year, but some are shrubs or trees. 5. The flowers of Asteraceae are typically composite, meaning they are made up of many small flowers arranged in a head or inflorescence. 6. Asteraceae are often used for ornamental purposes, and many species are grown in gardens for their showy flowers. 7. Some Asteraceae are also used for medicinal purposes, such as treating colds and fevers. 8. The family is known for its unique reproductive system, in which the pollen is transferred by wind or insects, rather than by birds or animals. 9. Asteraceae are also known for their ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, which makes them valuable for improving soil fertility. 10. The family has a long history of use in traditional medicine, and many species are still used today for a variety of purposes.

the United States.passage: United States The United States of America (commonly referred to as the United States or America) is a federal republic consisting of 50 states, a federal district, and various territories. The country is situated in North America, bordering on the north by Canada and on the south by Mexico. The United States is the world's third-largest country by total area, after Russia and Canada. It is the fourth-most populous country in the world, with a population of over 328 million people. The United States has a capitalist mixed-market economy, which is the world's largest by nominal GDP. The United States is a founding member of the United Nations, World Trade Organization, G7, G20, and NATO. The country has a diverse landscape, ranging from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean, and from the Gulf of Mexico to the Great Lakes. The United States is known for its cultural diversity, with a population that includes people from a wide range of ethnic, racial, and religious backgrounds.

qae_pairs.question: What organization is the answer to a question that contains the term 'the United States'?
qae_pairs.explanation: The organization that is the answer to a question that contains the term 'the United States' is the World Trade Organization (WTO). The United States is a founding member of the WTO, which is an intergovernmental organization that was established to facilitate international trade and ensure that trade flows as smoothly, predictably, and freely as possible. The WTO is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, and has 164 member countries as of 2021.

qae_pairs.question: What body of water separates the United States from Canada?

Solanum lycopersicum.passage: Solanum lycopersicum, commonly known as the tomato, is a nightshade fruit that is grown and consumed around the world. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which also includes potatoes, peppers, and eggplants. The tomato is native to South America, but it has been cultivated and hybridized for thousands of years, resulting in a wide variety of cultivars that vary in size, shape, and color. Tomatoes are typically round or oblong, with a smooth, glossy skin that ranges in color from deep red to yellow. They are often used as a vegetable in savory dishes, but they are also used in many sweet dishes, such as tomato sauce, ketchup, and tomato paste. Tomatoes are a good source of vitamins A and C, as well as potassium and folate. Tomatoes are easy to grow and can be grown in a variety of soils and climates. They are typically grown from seed, which can be started indoors or outdoors. Tomatoes require full sun and regular watering, and they are susceptible to a variety of pests and diseases, including tomato hornworms, whiteflies, and blight. Overall, the tomato is a versatile and nutritious fruit that is enjoyed by people around the world. Its history and cultivation have made it a staple in many cuisines and cultures, and it continues to be an important crop for farmers and gardeners alike.

qae_pairs.question: What is the native region of Solanum lycopersicum, according to the passage?
qae_pairs.explanation: According to the passage, Solanum lycopersicum is native to South America.

qae_pairs.question: What is the family that Solanum lycopersicum belongs to?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Solanaceae family is the family that Solanum lycopersicum belongs to. This family includes other plants such as potatoes, peppers, and eggplants.

South America.passage: 1. South America is the fourth largest continent in the world, with a total area of 17,840,000 square kilometers. 2. qae_pairs.question: What dish is commonly associated with South America and contains the term 'South America' in the question?

Southeast Asia.passage: 1. Southeast Asia or Southeastern Asia is a subregion of Asia, consisting of the countries that are geographically south of China and east of India. 2. The region is bordered to the north by East Asia, to the west by the Indian subcontinent, to the east by Oceania, and to the south by the Indian Ocean and the Pacific Ocean. 3. The area covered by Southeast Asia is about 4.5 million square kilometers, and it is home to more than 640 million people. 4. Southeast Asia is home to many different ethnic groups, including the Malay, the Indonesian, the Thai, the Vietnamese, the Khmer, the Burmese, and the Filipino. 5. The region is known for its diverse cultures, languages, and religions, with Buddhism, Hinduism, Islam, and Christianity all being practiced in different parts of the region. 6. Southeast Asia is also known for its rich natural resources, including oil, gas, coal, timber, and fish. 7. The region is home to some of the world's most biodiverse ecosystems, including rainforests, coral reefs, and mangrove forests. 8. Southeast Asia has a tropical climate, with hot and humid weather throughout the year. 9. The region is prone to natural disasters, including typhoons, floods, and earthquakes. 10. Southeast Asia has a long and complex history, with evidence of human habitation in the region dating back to prehistoric times. 11.

qae_pairs.question: What body of water borders Southeast Asia to the south and west?

Antarctica.passage: 1. Antarctica is the highest, driest, windiest, and coldest continent on Earth. 2. It is located in the Southern Hemisphere, and is the fifth largest continent, with an area of 14,000,000 square kilometers. 3. The continent is covered by a thick layer of ice, which is up to 4,800 meters thick in some places. 4. The South Pole is located in Antarctica, and is the southernmost point on Earth. 5. The first person to reach the South Pole was Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen in 1911. 6. Antarctica is home to many species of animals, including penguins, seals, and whales. 7. The continent is also home to many research stations, where scientists study topics such as climate change and geology. 8. Tourism is not allowed in Antarctica, and visitors must be accompanied by a licensed guide. 9. The continent is governed by the Antarctic Treaty, which was signed in 1959 by 12 countries. 10. Today, there are 54 countries that have signed the treaty, which sets guidelines for scientific research and environmental protection in Antarctica.

qae_pairs.question: What year did the first expedition to Antarctica take place?  Answer: 1911.
qae_pairs.explanation: The first expedition to Antarctica took place in 1911, led by Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen.

qae_pairs.question: What is the location of Antarctica, and what is the thickness of the layer of ice that covers the continent?
qae_pairs.explanation: Antarctica is located in the Southern Hemisphere, and is the fifth largest continent, with an area of 14,000,000 square kilometers. The layer of ice that covers the continent is up to 4,800 meters thick in some places.

qae_pairs.question: What year was the Antarctic Treaty signed, which established guidelines for scientific research and environmental protection in Antarctica?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Antarctic Treaty was signed in 1959.

India.passage: India is a country in South Asia. It is the seventh-largest country by area and with more than 1.3 billion people, it is the second-most populous country in the world. India's capital is New Delhi, and its largest city is Mumbai. India's border with Pakistan is a long-standing dispute. The Indian economy is the world's seventh-largest by nominal GDP and the third-largest by purchasing power parity (PPP). India is a federal parliamentary democratic republic and is a member of the United Nations, the World Trade Organization, the G20, BRICS, the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, and the Commonwealth. India is known for its diverse culture, traditions, and languages. Hindi and English are the official languages of the Union Government. India is also a hub for spiritual and religious tourism, attracting millions of visitors each year.

qae_pairs.question: What international organization does India belong to?
qae_pairs.explanation: India is a member of several international organizations, including the United Nations, the World Trade Organization, the G20, BRICS, the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, and the Commonwealth. The United Nations is a global intergovernmental organization founded in 1945 to promote international cooperation and maintain international peace and security. India is a founding member of the United Nations and has played an active role in its operations and decision-making processes. Therefore, the correct answer to the question is the United Nations.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the international organization that India is a member of, which is also known as the Group of 20?
qae_pairs.explanation: The international organization that India is a member of, which is also known as the Group of 20, is the G20.

qae_pairs.explanation: The country that shares a long-standing dispute with India along their border is Pakistan.

qae_pairs.explanation: The official language of the Union Government in India is Hindi.

qae_pairs.explanation: Mumbai is the largest city in India, as mentioned in the passage.

qae_pairs.explanation: The organization mentioned as a member of India's official languages is the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation.

South Asia.passage: South Asia is a region of the world that encompasses a vast array of cultures, languages, and traditions. It is home to over 1.7 billion people, making it one of the most populous regions on the planet. The region is bordered by the Indian Ocean to the south, and is home to some of the world's most iconic landmarks, including the Taj Mahal, the Great Wall of India, and the ancient city of Mohenjo-Daro. South Asia is home to several of the world's largest and most populous countries, including India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka. These countries have rich histories and cultures, with influences from ancient empires such as the Maurya and Gupta empires, as well as the British Empire. The region is also known for its diverse range of religions, including Hinduism, Islam, Buddhism, and Christianity. South Asia is home to some of the world's most sacred sites, including the Vaishno Devi Temple, the Golden Temple, and the Bodh Gaya. Despite its many strengths, South Asia faces numerous challenges, including poverty, political instability, and environmental degradation. However, the region is also home to some of the world's most innovative and forward-thinking individuals and organizations, who are working tirelessly to address these issues and create a better future for all.

qae_pairs.question: What country in South Asia is known as the 'land of the arches' and has a population of over 160 million people, with the capital city being Dhaka?
qae_pairs.explanation: Bangladesh is the country in South Asia that is known as the 'land of the arches' and has a population of over 160 million people, with the capital city being Dhaka.

qae_pairs.question: What body of water borders South Asia to the south and what is its name?
qae_pairs.explanation: The body of water that borders South Asia to the south is the Indian Ocean.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the sacred site located in South Asia that is visited by millions of pilgrims each year?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Vaishno Devi Temple is a sacred site located in South Asia that is visited by millions of pilgrims each year. It is one of the most revered and visited pilgrimage sites in India, and is dedicated to the Hindu goddess Vaishno Devi. The temple is located in the state of Jammu and Kashmir, and is accessible by a 13-kilometer trek through the Himalayan mountains.

qae_pairs.question: What empire is mentioned in the passage as having influenced the cultures and traditions of South Asia?
qae_pairs.explanation: The passage mentions the Maurya and Gupta empires as having influenced the cultures and traditions of South Asia.

centuries.passage: 1. In the 16th century, the Renaissance was a cultural movement that emphasized the study of classical Greek and Roman texts. 2. The 17th century saw the rise of the Enlightenment, which promoted reason and individualism. 3. In the 18th century, the Industrial Revolution transformed the way goods were produced, leading to mass production and the growth of factories. 4. The 19th century was marked by the expansion of European empires and the development of new technologies such as the telegraph and telephone. 5. The 20th century saw two world wars, the Cold War, and the emergence of the United States as a superpower. 6. In the 21st century, the world has become increasingly interconnected through the internet and globalization.

qae_pairs.question: What country has been the dominant economic power for several centuries?     Answer: the United States.
qae_pairs.explanation: The United States has been the dominant economic power for several centuries. This can be attributed to its strong economy, advanced technology, and strategic geographical location. Throughout the centuries, the United States has played a significant role in shaping global economic policies and has been a leader in international trade. Its economic dominance has allowed it to exert significant political influence on the world stage.

Central America.passage: Central America is the southernmost, isthmian portion of the North American continent, which connects North America with South America on the Isthmus of Panama. Central America is bordered by Mexico to the north, Colombia to the southeast, and the Caribbean Sea to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west. Central America has a population of around 49 million people, and the main language spoken is Spanish. The region has a rich history dating back to the Maya civilization, and there are many archaeological sites throughout the area. The main countries in Central America are Belize, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Panama. Each country has its own unique culture and attractions, from the beautiful beaches of Costa Rica to the ancient ruins of Tikal in Guatemala. Central America is also known for its biodiversity, with rainforests, volcanoes, and coral reefs found throughout the region. The area is home to many endangered species, including jaguars, sea turtles, and macaws. Overall, Central America is a diverse and fascinating region with a lot to offer travelers, from stunning natural landscapes to rich cultural experiences.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the ancient Maya city located in Central America?     What is the name of the ancient Maya city located in Central America?     What is the name of the largest ancient Maya city located in Central America?     What is the name of the ancient Maya city
qae_pairs.explanation: The name of the largest ancient Maya city located in Central America is Tikal.

qae_pairs.explanation: The Maya civilization had a significant impact on Central America's history.

Glycine max.passage: Glycine max, also known as soybean, is a species of legume native to East Asia, which is widely cultivated and used for food, oil, and animal feed. It is an important crop in many countries, including the United States, Brazil, and China. Soybean is a hardy plant that can grow in a variety of soil types and climates, and it is often used as a rotation crop to prevent soil-borne diseases. The seeds are typically harvested when the pods are mature, and they can be roasted, boiled, or ground into flour. Soybean is a rich source of protein, fiber, and other nutrients, and it has been shown to have a number of health benefits, including reducing the risk of heart disease and certain types of cancer.

qae_pairs.question: What is the answer to the question that contains the term 'Glycine max' and refers to the region where the plant is native?
qae_pairs.explanation: The answer to the question that contains the term 'Glycine max' and refers to the region where the plant is native is East Asia.

qae_pairs.question: What country is the largest producer of Glycine max?
qae_pairs.explanation: China is the largest producer of Glycine max, also known as soybean. The country's vast acreage and favorable growing conditions make it a top producer of this legume, which is widely cultivated and used for food, oil, and animal feed. Soybean is an important crop in many countries, including the United States, Brazil, and China, and it is often used as a rotation crop to prevent soil-borne diseases.

South.passage: South is one of the four cardinal directions on a compass, and it is the direction that is in the southern hemisphere of Earth. The south direction is opposite to the north direction. In many cultures, the south is associated with concepts such as warmth, heat, and light. In Western culture, the south is often associated with the sun, while in Eastern culture, it is associated with the moon. The south is also associated with the summer season, and it is often seen as a symbol of growth and abundance. In many cultures, the south is also associated with the afterlife, as it is believed to be the direction in which the sun sets and the dead go after death.

qae_pairs.question: What is the direction of the Eastern South?  Answer: The direction of the Eastern South is towards the east.
qae_pairs.explanation: The direction of the Eastern South is towards the east.

Lima.passage: Lima is the capital and largest city of Peru. It is located in the valleys of the Chilln, Rmac and Lurn rivers, in the coastal region of the country, overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Together with the seaport of Callao, it forms a contiguous urban area known as the Lima Metropolitan Area, which has a population of over 9 million inhabitants, making it the most populous area in Peru and the second-largest city in the Americas, after So Paulo. Lima was founded by Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro on January 18, 1535, as Ciudad de los Reyes (City of the Kings). It became the capital of the Spanish Empire in the Americas and was the center of the Viceroyalty of Peru until its independence in 1821. Today, Lima is a major cultural and economic center in the Americas, and is home to numerous museums, universities, and cultural institutions. Its architecture, cuisine, and traditions reflect the city's rich history and cultural diversity.

qae_pairs.question: What was the name of the Spanish conquistador who founded Lima on January 18, 1535?
qae_pairs.explanation: Francisco Pizarro was the Spanish conquistador who founded Lima on January 18, 1535.

qae_pairs.question: What was the name of the administrative division that included Lima during the colonial period? Answer: The Viceroyalty of Peru.
qae_pairs.explanation: The administrative division that included Lima during the colonial period was the Viceroyalty of Peru.

qae_pairs.question: What date was Lima founded by Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro?
qae_pairs.explanation: According to the passage, Lima was founded by Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro on January 18, 1535.

qae_pairs.question: What river flows through Lima and is a source of water for the city?
qae_pairs.explanation: The river that flows through Lima and is a source of water for the city is the Rmac.

qae_pairs.question: What was the year that Lima gained its independence from the Spanish Empire?
qae_pairs.explanation: According to the passage, Lima gained its independence from the Spanish Empire in 1821.
